pageContext.claim: “We've been ripped off, Sean, by the world. All of these countries for years and years and we can't do it anymore.”
pageContext.analysis: It's not that hard to find countries with which the U.S. runs a trade surplus in goods. At the top of the list are Hong Kong, the Netherlands, the United Arab Emirates, Belgium and Australia. Furthermore, countries do not lose money on trade. A trade deficit simply means that people in one country are buying more goods from another country than people in the second country are buying from the first country.
